Title: The Kind Worth Killing
Description: On a night flight from London to Boston, Ted Severson meets the stunning and mysterious Lily Kintner. Sharing one too many martinis, the strangers begin to play a game of truth, revealing very intimate details about themselves. Ted talks about his marriage that’s going stale and his wife Miranda, who he’s sure is cheating on him. But their game turns a little darker when Ted jokes that he could kill Miranda for what she’s done. Lily, without missing a beat, says calmly, “I’d like to help.” After all, some people are the kind worth killing, like a lying, stinking, cheating spouse. Back in Boston, Ted and Lily’s twisted bond grows stronger as they begin to plot Miranda's demise. Suddenly these co-conspirators are embroiled in a chilling game of cat-and-mouse, one they both cannot survive . . . with a shrewd and very determined detective on their tail.

Title: First Time Caller
Description: A hopeless romantic meets a jaded radio host in this cozy, Sleepless in Seattle-inspired love story. Aiden Valentine has a secret: he's fallen out of love with love. And as the host of Baltimore's romance hotline, that's a bit of a problem. But when a young girl calls in to the station asking for dating advice for her mom, the interview goes viral. Lucie Stone thought she was doing just fine. But when all of Baltimore is suddenly scrutinizing her love life-or lack thereof—she begins to question if she's as happy as she thought. Maybe a little more romance wouldn't be such a bad thing.

Title: The Shining
Description: Jack Torrance's new job at the Overlook Hotel is the perfect chance for a fresh start. As the off-season caretaker at the atmospheric old hotel, he'll have plenty of time to spend reconnecting with his family and working on his writing. But as the harsh winter weather sets in, the idyllic location feels ever more remote...and more sinister. And the only one to notice the strange and terrible forces gathering around the Overlook is Danny Torrance, a uniquely gifted five-year-old.

Title: Love, Theoretically
Description: Theoretical physicist Elsie Hannaway, by day, she’s an adjunct professor, in the hopes of landing tenure. By other day, Elsie makes up for her non-existent paycheck by offering her services as a fake girlfriend. Honestly, it’s a pretty sweet gig—until her carefully constructed Elsie-verse comes crashing down. Because Jack Smith, the annoyingly attractive and broody older brother of her favorite client, turns out to be the cold-hearted experimental physicist who ruined her mentor’s career, but those long, penetrating looks? Is she falling in love?

Title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
Short_Review: Universally popular among both kids and adults, Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone is a book that took children's fantasy to new heights. A must-read book for one and all.

Title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
Things We Hide From The Light
Things We Left Behind
Short_Review: This is a contemporary romance or smut novel, which is a mix of drama and super-steamy stuff. Not recommended for children and teenagers, but highly recommended for erotica lovers.

Title: The Housemaid
Description: Every day I clean the Winchesters’ beautiful house top to bottom. I collect their daughter from school. I try to ignore how Nina tells strange lies about her own daughter. And how her husband Andrew seems more broken every day. But as I look into Andrew’s handsome brown eyes, so full of pain, it’s hard not to imagine what it would be like to live Nina’s life. But I reassure myself: the Winchesters don’t know who I really am. An unbelievably twisty read that will have you glued to the pages late into the night.
Short_Review: This is an easy-to-read and almost difficult-to-put-down book. It is both suspenseful and funny. I recommend this Young Adult thriller for all thriller fans.

Title: Never Lie
Description: Newlyweds Tricia and Ethan are searching for the house of their dreams. But when they visit the remote manor that once belonged to Dr. Adrienne Hale, a renowned psychiatrist who vanished without a trace four years earlier, a violent winter storm traps them at the estate. As Tricia listens to the cassette tapes of Dr. Hale, she learns about the terrifying chain of events leading up to her mysterious disappearance.
Short_Review: This is another interesting psychological thriller by Freida McFadden, the author of The Housemaid, with interesting twists.

Title: And Then There Were None
Short_Review: This novel is a psychological thriller where ten strangers are invited to a remote island and mysteriously killed one by one. The suspense builds as the survivors try to figure out who among them is the killer.

Title: Dune
Short_Review: A richly imagined sci-fi epic exploring politics, religion, and ecology on the desert planet Arrakis.

Title: Big Three
Author(s): Isaac Asimov, Robert A. Heinlein, Arthur C. Clarke

Title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
The Notebook
Short_Review: Deep, emotional, a story of finding "the one", worth a read for all romance lovers

Title: The Cuckoo's Calling
Short_Review: Boring, too long, more like drama and not a thriller, not recommended.

Title: Truly Devious
Short_Review: Excellent, can't put down, and even though the mystery isn't fully solved, it makes you want to buy the next novel in the series.

Title: The Silent Patient
Short_Review: A gripping psychological thriller about a woman’s act of violence against her husband—and the therapist obsessed with uncovering her motive.

Title: The Theory of Everything
Short_Review: A must-read book for everyone interested in understanding our universe. The genius author has kept the mathematics minimal, while trying his best to explain complicated concepts in simple ways.

Title: Relativity: The Special and the General Theory
Short_Review: A must-read book for anyone interested in physics, as the genius Albert Einstein walks us through his ground-breaking theories that changed the world of physics and how scientists think.

Title: The Demon-Haunted World: Science as a Candle in the Dark
A Good Girl's Guide to Murder
Data Science fromScratch
Short_Review: This is a good book for those who want to get started with data science. The author explains several concepts one needs to know, like probability, statistics, Python programming syntax, SQL, and basic machine learning in simple ways for beginners.

Title: The Hundred-Page Machine Learning Book
Short_Review: This book goes into the details of basic machine learning algorithms and deep learning algorithms but is also brief, so it is a good book for machine elarning enthusiasts, children and adults alike.

Title: I Bet You'd Look Good in a Coffin
Animal Farm
Short_Review: This political satire uses animal characters in a farm to compare them with the state of human beings and how they fight one another. This book was even banned for its fierce criticism of totalitarianism.

Title: The Second Sex
Short_Review: The Second Sex is regarded as a must-read book for both men and women, and rightfully so.

Title: How to Make Friends and Influence People?
It Ends With Us
Short_Review: This emotionally intense novel explores themes of love, resilience, and difficult choices. It follows Lily Bloom as she navigates a complicated relationship with a charming neurosurgeon, while confronting painful memories from her past.

Title: The Girl with The Dragon Tattoo
Short_Review: This novel is a gripping blend of investigative journalism and psychological suspense, featuring the unforgettable character Lisbeth Salander.

Title: A Short History of Nearly Everything
Short_Review: This book is a brilliant and accessible journey through the history of science—from the Big Bang to the rise of civilization. Bryson explains complex scientific concepts with wit and clarity, making it perfect for curious minds of all ages.

Title: Brief Answers to the Big Questions
Short_Review: Hawking’s final book explores profound questions about the universe in an accessible way.

Title: Astrophysics for People in a Hurry
Short_Review: A concise and engaging introduction to astrophysics, perfect for curious young minds.

Title: The Power of Your Subconscious Mind
Ikigai: The Japanese Secret to a Long and Happy Life
The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People
